quiz.question: Who developed the Equity Theory of Motivation?
What is the primary focus of the Equity Theory of Motivation?
According to Equity Theory, which of the following is an example of an input?
What is the formula that expresses the concept of equity in Adams' Equity Theory?
What happens when an employee perceives that they are under-rewarded?

options.a: They feel a sense of satisfaction
options.b: They may feel resentment and demotivation

quiz.question: Which of the following best describes over-rewarded inequity?

options.a: An employee feels they are receiving more rewards than their efforts deserve
options.b: An employee feels they are contributing more than they are rewarded for
options.c: An employee feels their rewards are perfectly matched with their inputs
options.d: An employee receives equal rewards to their inputs

quiz.question: Which of the following is an example of a reference person or group in the context of Equity Theory?

options.a: A co-worker in the same organization

quiz.question: What is the primary motivation behind employees' actions in response to perceived inequity?

options.a: To increase their outputs without altering inputs
options.b: To restore fairness in their input-output ratio
options.c: To seek promotions at any cost

quiz.question: How does perception of fairness play a role in Equity Theory?

options.a: Fairness is determined by actual rewards and inputs only
options.b: Perceived fairness is more important than actual fairness
options.c: Perception has no effect on motivation
options.d: Employees only care about financial rewards

quiz.question: Which of the following is true about the difference between equity and equality?

options.a: Equity means treating everyone the same, while equality means fair treatment based on contributions
options.b: Equity refers to fairness based on individual contributions, while equality means everyone gets the same
options.c: Equality is focused on individual needs, while equity focuses on organizational standards
options.d: There is no difference between equity and equality
